# @andes/form

Form allows the user to input data, and is a system defined by the relationship between several form controls and their criteria of use.

The UI specs are defined in _[Andes UI](http://andes.ml.com).

## How to use

### Installation

> Follow the [general installation guide](../../docs/installation.md).

```bash
$ npm install --save @andes/form
```

### Styles

> Follow the [general styles usage guide](../../docs/styles-usage.md) for configuration and how-tos.

Import the component in your bundle:

```scss
@import '~@andes/form/index';
```

### Scripts

> Follow the [general scripts usage guide](../../docs/scripts-usage.md) for configuration and how-tos.

Import the component using `require` in your page:

```jsx
const Form = require('@andes/form');
```

## Examples

For full demo and configuration options, check out the [story for Form](https://mercadolibre.github.io/frontend-andes_ui/?selectedKind=Form).

`Form` should wrap other form control components, such as `TextField`, `Dropdown`, `Checkbox` and `RadioButton`.

```jsx
<Form>
  <TextField label="Name" />
</Form>
```

| Property | Description | Type | Default | Required |
| -------- | ----------- | ---- | ------- | -------- |
| `children` | Custom content. Ideally other form control components, such as `TextField`, `Dropdown`, `Checkbox` and `RadioButton`. | node |  | âœ… |
| `className` | Custom class. | string | `''` |  |
